alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 04 at 9:15PM PST until March 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches for elevations above 3000 ft to locally over 1 foot above 4000 ft. A wintry mix down to 1500 feet is possible with a coating of 3 to 6 inches of snow. Wind gusts of 30 to 45 mph may lead to blowing snow and reduced visibilities. * WHERE...Snow is possible above 1500 feet, with highest accumulations above 3000 feet in the North Bay Mountains. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Slick, snow-covered roads and hiking trails. Hikers, campers, and outdoor enthusiasts may encounter dangerous winter conditions above the snow level. Heavier snow showers could produce limited visibilities. Downed trees and power outages possible.
